name: Hau Chan
content: Home Hau ChanAssistant ProfessorSchool of ComputingUniversity of Nebraska-LincolnOffice: Avery 363e-mail: hchan3 [at] nebraska.edu (formerly hchan3 [at] unl.edu)Phone: 402-472-5091 Research Areas: Artificial Intelligence (AI), AI for Society and Social Good, Game Theory, Mechanism Design, Machine LearningMy main research lies in multi-agent aspects of AI for Society and Social Good, focusing on developing modeling and algorithmic foundations for tackling societal problems involving agents and predicting agent behavior in societal contexts, leveraging artificial intelligence (AI), game theory, mechanism design, and machine learning to better inform policymaking and (collective) decision-making. In recent years, our teams have been actively addressing societal challenges and fairness issues in various domains, including security (e.g., reducing potential vulnerability), public health (e.g., reducing substance use and homelessness), and urban planning (e.g., improving accessibility to public facilities). Currently, I lead the Computational Decision Science (CDS) Lab. Current Research Paradigms: Game-theoretic Models for Examining Agent BehaviorMechanism Design for Addressing Societal ProblemsResource Allocation and Optimization for Social GoodCollective Decision Making for Social DomainsMachine Learning for Public HealthI am looking for motivated students to work on research projects in the areas of game theory, mechanism design, or AI for social good(s). If you are interested, please contact me (via customized emails discussing my research/papers that you have read) and apply to the UNL CS graduate program.
